alert.note: Alert for Cullman; Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:54AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Marshall, Jackson, southern Madison, northern Cullman and Morgan Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 253 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Meridianville to Brushy Lake. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntsville, Decatur, Madison, Scottsboro, Hartselle, Guntersville, Arab, Bridgeport, Redstone Arsenal and Moores Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
